Vanya got bored, and to have fun, he decided to perform $$$n - 1$$$ operations.Operation number $$$x$$$ (operations are numbered in order starting from $$$1$$$) is as follows:Choose $$$2$$$ different numbers $$$1 \\leq u,v \\leq n$$$, such that $$$|a_u - a_v|$$$ is divisible by $$$x$$$.Add an undirected edge between vertices $$$u$$$ and $$$v$$$ to the graph.Help Vanya get a connected$$$^{\\text{∗}}$$$ graph using the $$$n - 1$$$ operations, or determine that it is impossible.$$$^{\\text{∗}}$$$A graph is called connected if it is possible to reach any vertex from any other by moving along the edges.InputEach test consists of multiple test cases. The first line contains an integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \\le t \\le 10^{3}$$$) — the number of test cases. Then follows the description of the test cases.The first line of each test case contains the number $$$n$$$ ($$$1 \\leq n \\leq 2000$$$) — the number of vertices in the graph.The second line of each test case contains $$$n$$$ numbers $$$a_1, a_2, \\cdots a_n$$$ ($$$1 \\leq a_i \\leq 10^9$$$).It is guaranteed that the sum of $$$n$$$ over all test cases does not exceed $$$2000$$$.OutputFor each test case, if there is no solution, then output "No" (without quotes).Otherwise, output "Yes" (without quotes), and then output $$$n - 1$$$ lines, where in the $$$i$$$-th line, output the numbers $$$u$$$ and $$$v$$$ that need to be chosen for operation $$$i$$$.You can output each letter in any case (for example, the strings "yEs", "yes", "Yes", and "YES" will be recognized as a positive answer).ExampleInput821 4499 7 1 13510 2 31 44 73587 6 81 44 32562 35 33 79 1656 51 31 69 42552 63 25 21 51233 40 3 11 31 43 37 8 50 5 12 22OutputYES 2 1 YES 4 1 2 1 3 2 YES 5 1 4 1 3 1 2 1 YES 4 1 3 1 2 1 5 4 YES 3 1 5 1 2 1 4 2 YES 4 1 5 1 2 1 3 2 YES 2 1 5 2 3 1 4 3 YES 9 1 12 9 11 1 10 1 6 1 7 6 2 1 8 2 5 2 3 1 4 1NoteLet's consider the second test case.First operation $$$(x = 1)$$$: we can connect vertices $$$4$$$ and $$$1$$$, since $$$|a_4 - a_1| = |13 - 99| = |-86| = 86$$$, and $$$86$$$ is divisible by $$$1$$$.Second operation $$$(x = 2)$$$: we can connect vertices $$$2$$$ and $$$1$$$, since $$$|a_2 - a_1| = |7 - 99| = |-92| = 92$$$, and $$$92$$$ is divisible by $$$2$$$.Third operation $$$(x = 3)$$$: we can connect vertices $$$3$$$ and $$$2$$$, since $$$|a_3 - a_2| = |1 - 7| = |-6| = 6$$$, and $$$6$$$ is divisible by $$$3$$$.From the picture, it can be seen that a connected graph is obtained.

You are given a graph with $n$ vertices (numbered from 1 to $n$) and an array of $n$ integers, $a$. Initially, there are no edges in the graph.

You need to add $n-1$ edges to the graph following these rules:

* For each operation $x$ (numbered from 1 to $n-1$):
    * Choose two different vertices $u$ and $v$ where $1 \le u, v \le n$.
    * The absolute difference between the values at those vertices in the array, $|a_u - a_v|$, must be divisible by $x$.
    * Add an undirected edge between vertices $u$ and $v$.

Determine if it is possible to create a connected graph using these operations. If possible, output "Yes" and list the pairs of vertices $(u, v)$ for each operation. If it is impossible, output "No".

You are given a set of numbers and need to connect them into a single group using a specific rule.  You can connect two numbers if the difference between them is divisible by a number that corresponds to the connection attempt.  

You have a limited number of connections to make. Determine if it's possible to connect all the numbers into a single group using the given rule. If possible, show the connections.
